reviews.review_msg: Jeremy was a great professor. His lectures were engaging and he made mathematics and physics accessible to people who were not strong in that department. I took this course for the Q and was surprised by how much I enjoyed this class and Jeremy as a professor.

The class is interesting - Venditti is engaged in current research and passionate about the topic. Unfortunately it has zero adaptions to be taught online and the arrogance of the professor suggests that's unlikely to change. The TA, Tingan, is disengaged and makes no attempt to teach. The labs are poorly worded and unclear. No longer a good class!
Helpful and responsive to any and all questions. Really clear about what will be on exams. Study the lectures.
Jeremy is a funny and quirky guy and knows his stuff but seems a little disorganized with his teaching style. There's a lot of readings that are mandatory and will be on tests for big marks.

Loved this class! He definitely has high passion for the class which makes lectures more interesting. Gives answers for exams in class so make sure you attend! Field trip was really fun too, learned lots.

Jeremy is poorly organized and not very good at communicating. He seemed awkward and uncomfortable as a lecturer. He was disrespectful towards students, answering phone calls during class and texting with the sound on while we wrote our midterm. Course material didnt cover much beyond GEOG 111. I would not recommend the course or him as a prof.
Good prof! Very enthusiastic about the subject and willing to answer questions. He gave lots of good hints to specific exam questions to those who attended the lectures.

Good prof. Field trip was lots of fun! He does well at explaining difficult concepts and really wants you to learn. He is very much a "normal guy" unlike a lot of other quirky professors. Loves to joke around as well. I wasn't too interested in the subject but he did well at communicating the material. Helps to have a foundation in math or physics.

Geography 213 has been one of my favourite courses. Jeremy is laid back and jokes around in class, sometimes at himself. His lectures were really informative, and concepts were stitched together pretty well. He also makes it really clear what's most important for the exams. The field trip was amazing! However, be ready for some vaguely-worded labs.

All around great teacher. Lectures were very informative and engaging. Fair marker, gives great insight , hints for what to study and whats relevant on tests. Would not recommend even getting the text book, as long as you attend all the lectures you'll do well.
Attend lectures, he will give hints throughout the lecture on what will be on the exams. Luckily there was no rain on the field trip. Interesting fellow.
Loves what he does and it shows. Had an awesome time, field trip was great too.
Great prof, don't bother with the textbook, go to class, take notes, get engaged with him and you'll do great. Boosted all our reports by one letter grade at the end because we all did well :)

If you are a grad student considering studying with him note that he is very difficult to get along with, is vague about instructions and methods, likes to expand the scope of your project beyond what you intended, and when not ignoring your work seems to enjoy taking it away from you and doing it himself. I suggest considering another grad prof.

Jeremy is very willing to answer questions. If you attend lectures and review the online notes you will do well on the midterm; memorize the equation he repeats a million times as it is guaranteed to be on the midterm (he reuses them). He occasionally can't pronounce geography terms which is quite funny and he's willing to laugh at it. Nice guy.

JV is awesome. This was by far my favorite class ever, and I'm a business student. He is very helpful, he cares about the students, he cares about the material and his lectures are interesting for the material he is going over. The field trip was EPIC. Oh and DO NOT buy the textbook, you don't need it at all, just go to lecture and read the slides.

All and all I loked this professor a lot. For a geography prof he is one of the best I have had at SFU so far. At least he is not boring and mono-tone. The contetn is what you would expect from geomorphology and there is a fieldtrip that is pretty fun. I would recommend this course with Mr. Vendetti - just attend lectures and take notes.

I found the class a lot harder than I expected just because I found the notes really hard to understand. I find using a geomorph textbook to be an absolute must. He really tries to help when answering questions but he's not always successful. He says his class doesn't involve a lot of math but some of the key mathematical concepts reappear again.

You dont need the book at all. Everything is on the lecture slides, his explinations arnt to great but hes nice and willing to help. He lectures on a certain equation through the whole term about how its all the processes in one~ know that equation for the midterm and final. Other than that not to difficult.
No Comments

Really nice guy, kinda dorky.  Has a real strong fondness for everyone he researched with at UC Berkeley (he refers to them quite a bit), but for good reason.  Very organized, and has lecture slides online.  Very willing to help you if you have questions.  Can't pronounce lithosphere, but it's really adorable when he tries!  I recommend this course
